byline.contributor: Daniel Victor contributed reporting from New York.

abstract: Judge Richard M Gergel of Federal District Court in Charleston, SC, grants Dylann S Roof's request to represent himself in his hate crimes trial on charges of killing nine African-American members of Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church; death penalty experts say they believe Roof will decline to present evidence of his mental state during shooting, which could hamper jury's ability to assess his moral culpability.

headline.print_headline: Defendant in Charleston Church Shootings Will Represent Himself at Trial
headline.main: Dylann Roof to Represent Himself at Trial in Charleston Church Shootings

keywords.value: Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church (Charleston, SC)
keywords.name: organizations

snippet: A federal judge called the request by Mr. Roof “strategically unwise,” but allowed him to have lawyers present as backup....
lead_paragraph: A federal judge called the request by Mr. Roof “strategically unwise,” but allowed him to have lawyers present as backup.
